body:
Hmm, I think that looks like http transport reading from a finished with handle somehow.

You say it only happens on retries?  So I guess that means that Seek has been called on the repeatable buffer.

Maybe it is `Seek` racing with `Read` somehow.

There is no locking on Seek and Read.

Can you see if you can reproduce with [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) please?  I suspect it will reproduce but it is possible fixes to the go1.11 runtime have fixed this too.

sorry, I meant to say, a retry of the full copy eventually fails as well.  normally around 9gigs gets transferred, then I can try again to see if more files get transferred and so on.  

I'll try latest beta tonight and see.
@ljr9600 did you mean to close this?  How did the testing with the beta go?
Sorry, i didn't mean to close it.  But the beta does seem to be better,  and no more panics.
OK, I'll leave this closed then, but let me know if it happens again with the beta - thanks.

Looks like I just encountered the same problem. On a subsequent execution of the same command line on the same data everything went fine so this is probably not something I'll be able to reproduce.

Note that the local storage system on my end is known to be flaky. This might simply be a case of missing error handling.


What is your rclone version:
1.44

Which OS you are using and how many bits:
CentOS 7.5 64bit

The command you were trying to run:
`rclone copy -v --transfers=25 /local/path remote:`

```
panic: runtime error: slice bounds out of range

goroutine 1337 [running]:
github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/readers.(*RepeatableReader).Read(0xc0002c0810, 0xc027062000, 0x1000, 0x1000, 0x0, 0xc02700a1e0, 0xc02700a1d0)
        /home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/readers/repeatable.go:56 +0x255
net/http.transferBodyReader.Read(0xc02706bcc0, 0xc027062000, 0x1000, 0x1000, 0x1000, 0x0, 0x0)
        /home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.11.1.linux.amd64/src/net/http/transfer.go:62 +0x56
io.(*LimitedReader).Read(0xc000718440, 0xc027062000, 0x1000, 0x1000, 0x1000, 0x0, 0x0)
        /home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.11.1.linux.amd64/src/io/io.go:448 +0x63
bufio.(*Writer).ReadFrom(0xc000a04d00, 0x1327ac0, 0xc000718440, 0x7fc0d8bfb0a8, 0xc000a04d00, 0xc0000dfc01)
        /home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.11.1.linux.amd64/src/bufio/bufio.go:707 +0xe4
io.copyBuffer(0x1326180, 0xc000a04d00, 0x1327ac0, 0xc000718440, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x106a5a0, 0xc02700a101, 0xc000718440)
        /home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.11.1.linux.amd64/src/io/io.go:388 +0x303
io.Copy(0x1326180, 0xc000a04d00, 0x1327ac0, 0xc000718440, 0x270, 0x0, 0x0)
        /home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.11.1.linux.amd64/src/io/io.go:364 +0x5a
net/http.(*transferWriter).writeBody(0xc02706bcc0, 0x1326180, 0xc000a04d00, 0x2, 0x2)
        /home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.11.1.linux.amd64/src/net/http/transfer.go:362 +0x5b8
net/http.(*Request).write(0xc01a859800, 0x1326180, 0xc000a04d00, 0x0, 0xc0210563c0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
        /home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.11.1.linux.amd64/src/net/http/request.go:645 +0x6e8
net/http.(*persistConn).writeLoop(0xc026fea000)
        /home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.11.1.linux.amd64/src/net/http/transport.go:1888 +0x1b8
created by net/http.(*Transport).dialConn
        /home/travis/.gimme/versions/go1.11.1.linux.amd64/src/net/http/transport.go:1339 +0x966
```

Hmm, I'll re-open this.

It looks very much like Read() and Seek() are being called concurrently so what I'll do is add a mutex which should fix the issue.

I merged the fix to master - it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and in v1.45.

Please let me know if it happens again!
I've updated to v1.44-080-g16f797a7 and will let you know if it happens again.

> I've updated to v1.44-080-g16f797a7 and will let you know if it happens again.

Thanks :-)

issue.title: panic: runtime error: slice bounds out of range

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

During the sync of 2 OneDrive for Business accounts with encryption enabled, rclone throw the following error
panic: runtime error: slice bounds out of range


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

1.41


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Ubuntu 16.04

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

OneDrive

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone sync crypt1:/ crypt2:/

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

goroutine 402791 [running]:
github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/readers.(*RepeatableReader).Read(0xc4202ec270, 0xc420539000, 0x1000, 0x1000, 0xc42d2b4c60, 0xc42d2b4c50, 0xc420453aa0)
        /home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/readers/repeatable.go:56 +0x260
net/http.transferBodyReader.Read(0xc42147d9a0, 0xc420539000, 0x1000, 0x1000, 0x56c, 0x0, 0xc42025d948)
        /opt/go/go1.10/src/net/http/transfer.go:60 +0x56
io.(*LimitedReader).Read(0xc4203cb2a0, 0xc420539000, 0x1000, 0x1000, 0x56c, 0x0, 0x0)
        /opt/go/go1.10/src/io/io.go:446 +0x63
bufio.(*Writer).ReadFrom(0xc42025d940, 0x112d460, 0xc4203cb2a0, 0x7fe2032d9a68, 0xc42025d940, 0x1)
        /opt/go/go1.10/src/bufio/bufio.go:703 +0xcd
io.copyBuffer(0x112c360, 0xc42025d940, 0x112d460, 0xc4203cb2a0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0xf0bda0, 0xc421487a01, 0xc4203cb2a0)
        /opt/go/go1.10/src/io/io.go:386 +0x31a
io.Copy(0x112c360, 0xc42025d940, 0x112d460, 0xc4203cb2a0, 0xc420539ca2, 0x101dd8e, 0x2)
        /opt/go/go1.10/src/io/io.go:362 +0x5a
net/http.(*transferWriter).WriteBody(0xc42147d9a0, 0x112c360, 0xc42025d940, 0x2, 0x2)
        /opt/go/go1.10/src/net/http/transfer.go:337 +0x5fa
net/http.(*Request).write(0xc4203aa700, 0x112c360, 0xc42025d940, 0x0, 0xc42030ed20, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
        /opt/go/go1.10/src/net/http/request.go:622 +0x6b2
net/http.(*persistConn).writeLoop(0xc4203f2fc0)
        /opt/go/go1.10/src/net/http/transport.go:1825 +0x1ea
created by net/http.(*Transport).dialConn
        /opt/go/go1.10/src/net/http/transport.go:1238 +0x97f
